Messages.Author: Maximilian Friebe
Messages.Content: Dear students, as there were so few students yesterday, we only held the "Sprechstunde" and not the actual lecure about postprocessing of simulation data. I have therefore uploaded a video of last year's post-processing lecture. We can clarify any questions in the upcoming lecture. Best, Max

Messages.Author: Maximilian Friebe
Messages.Content: Dear students, I have uploaded the folder with the files for the upcoming lecture about postprocessing of simulation result in Python. The lecture will be held mostly with jupyter notebook, which is preinstalled on anaconda. If you want to run the Code on your own computer in parallel you have to install anaconda, as it is explained in 01 CEG SoSe24 and the python-libraries: pandas numpy datetime matplotlib Some of these libraries might be already preinstalled. On the anaconda website you can find out how to install python libraries with anaconda.  See you tomorrow!  Max

Should I call zone 11 a zone group and then only show this zone group for the results?  Or what approach would you chose to focus on zone 11, only, and get the simulations comparable best. Thx, Desiree

Messages.Author: Maximilian Friebe
Messages.Content: Hi Desiree,  I would use the results of the overheating simulation for the worst month. Please use the results of the individual models and not the "compare results" as they tend to be strange.  Best, Max

Messages.Author: Katalin Julianna Fülep
Messages.Content: Hey,  - It´s a typo, the calculation should equal 0.4 no./m2 of course. - 300 days should correspond to c.a. 6 days/week yes. - Set the same MET value in all zones. - Set the same equipment´s load in all zones. - Hörsaal, Auditorium [nr. 9] has a usage of 150 day/year, which should correspond to (150/375)*7 = c.a. 3 days/week. - Your Task 1 looks fine based on those results. :)  Best, Kata

Messages.Author: Desiree Anne Leinenbach
Messages.Content: Hi, for zone 9 I copied the zone from level 0 when redoing everything from scratch. When I now wanted to run the simlulation I got the errors that occupant, light and equiptment aren't inside the zone. What to do? Just redo the zone and hope it's gonna be ok?

Messages.Author: Desiree Anne Leinenbach
Messages.Content: After closing IDA ICE and opening the project again, I only got error messages that the lights weren't inside the zone 1,3,5,7,9. So I moved them inside the zone (no idea why they were outside and where I placed them in the end), but then I could run the simulation. I have the feeling that this new version has a lot of bugs.  But I got new warnings, see enclosed.

Messages.Author: Katalin Julianna Fülep
Messages.Content: Hey Desiree,  The objects ending up outside the zone might be because when you lock the zones and copy-paste, they kind of get pasted to the wrong level. We can look at it the next lecture.  To your other question: Warnings in IDA ICE does not necessarily indicate a problem, it just warns you about a fact. So in this case, those walls are not connected to any zones or exterior environment. This happens either when there is a too big space between zones/between zone and building body, or when you have very small wall portions (this happens usually when the zone is created automatically). Adiabatic refers to that no heat flow happens through that wall. This is usually not a problem, you can run your model just as usual. We can discuss this further next lecture!  Best, Kata

Messages.Author: Desiree Anne Leinenbach
Messages.Content: Thx a lot! And sorry to have to bother you with further questions: As Wind profile I could chose City center (ASHRAE 1993) - but how can I set it to "semi exposed"? Where can I set the HVAC: -Standard Plant -Constant temperature: 16°C -Heat exchanger: Always on, effectiveness=0.6?  And: From the picture I understand that I have to add the windows on both floors? Thx

Messages.Author: Katalin Julianna Fülep
Messages.Content: - Whether the building is exposed or sheltered effects the wind pressure coefficients. So you have to go to "Pressure coefficients" and choose the profile by clicking on "Auto fill". It is indeed a bit hidden.  - HVAC Standard Plant you can find in the "Palette" if you open up the "Side Bar" on the top of the screen. You have a lot of templates for different Air Handling Units (different controllers, system settings and equipment). In the task we use the "Standard air handling unit", but it is also the default one, so you actually don´t have to change anything. - The constant temperature refers to a constant supply air temperature of the ventilation to the zones. This you can define if you open up your "Air Handling Unit" and under "setpoint for supply air temperature", choose constant and write 16C in the box for "Constant temp [C]". - For setting the heat exchanger properties, you also have to open up your Air Handling Unit. The box/object with the "+" and "-" sign represents the heat exchanger. Open it up and there you can set the "Effectiveness" and the "Heat exchanger operation" connected to it.  All these settings in the task are by default values in IDA ICE, meaning that you do not have to change anything. We have not dealt with these during the lectures yet, but we wanted you to be aware of its properties for the analysis, as they do effect the results.  I hope I could explain it clearly, let us know if there is anything else!  p.s. the windows are on both floors yes. They should follow when you copy-paste the zones from the first floor to the second. Alternatively, you should also be able to copy-paste them in the 3-D view.

Messages.Author: Katalin Julianna Fülep
Messages.Content: Hey Ratu,  Yes, we will always upload the slides after the classes. In today's slides, you'll find details about how the course will be evaluated. 20 % of your grade comes from a portfolio, which includes three different tasks. The first task will be introduced on May 7th, and the deadline to submit is May 20th. I understand you might not be around by then, so we'll try to explain everything clearly in the slides. Since you won't be able to attend the "Sprechstunde" dedicated to the task, feel free to ask any questions here on the forum, and we'll try to help you out.  Also, remember to register on the course before May 14th.  Regards, Kata
